snippet: Facing investor demands for action, Yahoo said it would lay off workers and explore possibilities that include sale of some assets.
abstract: Yahoo chief executive Marissa Mayer is asking shareholders for patience as company pursues multipronged strategy of spinning out its core assets, even as it seeks to revitalize; remains open to selling core assets as well; announces that it will lay off roughly 15 percent of its total workforce, and that Charles Schwab, one of its directors, is resigning.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Facing investor demands for action, Yahoo said it would lay off workers and explore possibilities that include sale of some assets.

headline.main: Marissa Mayer Sets Yahoo on Streamlined Course
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Says It Is Open to Offers and Will Lay Off 15% of Its Work Force
